front.title: IPNGLS - IP Next Generation Label Switching

abstract.t: This document proposes the forwarding of IPv6 packets using label switching techniques, with the same advantages of the Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) architecture. The document proposes the mapping of all MPLS header fields into the IPv6 header, raising several advantages like the simplicity of the model, the decrease of overhead, and others. This mapping was called IP Next Generation Label Switching, or just IPngLS, and can work concurrently with MPLS, i.e. IPv6 packets are forwarded with IPngLS and IPv4 packets are forwarded with MPLS.
